lines.text: You must reduce expenses, they are too high.
We do our best, Frau Oberin. The children complain they are hungry.
Hungry? We Prussians have always been hungry. They are the daughters of soldiers and, God willing, mothers of soldiers too. What they need is discipline, not a life of luxury.
Through discipline and hunger we will become great.
It was awful to see Manuela so drunk.
You have to drink sometimes, from anger, or worry. I understand it very well.
What you call sins, I call the great spirit of love, in all its forms.
Manuela, pull yourself together. Soldiers' daughters don't cry.
I'm with Fraulein von Burnberg.
Be careful you don't fall in love.
I try to be a friend to the children.
On equal terms?
Why not?
How can you maintain your authority?
We must stimulate their competitive spirit.
Precisely, Fraulein von Attems.

When you say goodnight and shut the door to your room I stare at the door in the darkness. I want to get up and come to you but I know that I can't. I think about when I leave the school and you'll still be here. And every night you kiss new girls...
What a silly idea!
I love you so, but you're always so distant. I can't ever go to your room, or talk to you, or...
Pull yourself together child. Forget you're a young girl and be a good friend. You know I can't make exceptions or the other girls will be jealous. But I think of you often, Manuela.
My mother says I mustn't be weak. The Fatherland needs people of steel.
My mother spent four years here too. Doesn't she remember how awful it is?
You must come to your senses. You must recover, whatever it takes.
Recover? From what?
You're not allowed to love me... so much.
You're responsible for this uproar, I won't allow revolutionary ideas. As long as I am in charge, it won't happen here.
I won't cling to my post. I know I can't stay here. I can't stand by and watch children made into scared, helpless creatures.
